speaker: blacksmith
dialog: My apprentice, I gift to you the Legendary Ancient Blade of the Hero, or LABOTH for short.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: The LABOTH is very powerful. It will guide itself to always block any attack, and it is able to kill most enemies in a single hit...

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: ...but it is also very, very old, and consequently very fragile.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: Any time you strike an object, be it a foe or merely a wall, the blade will likely shatter, decreasing its length.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: The blade will also shatter if it blocks an attack.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: The LABOTH emits a magical light that illuminates the area around it. You can use the strength of this light to judge the reach of your attacks.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: I've prepared an obstacle course for you to get accustomed to the LABOTH. It's stocked with several enemies, so that you may test your swordsmanship...

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: ...but don't feel too bad about fleeing, especially if you can get to a better position so you can strike without fear of shattering your sword upon the walls.
<press [SPACEBAR] to swing the LABOTH>

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: By now your blade is likely damaged, leaving you vulnerable.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: Fear not! Damaged equipment is no problem for a blacksmith, even a novice such as yourself!

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: Here, take this hammer. You can use it to repair the LABOTH with obsidian shards, such as those commonly found among the old pots that litter dungeons.
<press [R] to repair your sword using collected shards>

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: The hammer has additional uses beyond repairs.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: You can use it to smash open pots to reveal the obsidian shards within...

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: ...or to smash the shells of enemies who might be mimicing those same pots!

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: The hammer can also temporarily stun enemies, but it takes a weapon such as the LABOTH to kill them for good.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: I've stocked the tunnels ahead with some pots so you can practice using your hammer.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: You can also use the obsidian you collect to repair the LABOTH, but remember:

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: a longer sword can take more damage and strike further out, but it may prove unwieldy in smaller spaces.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: Similarly, a shorter sword is less likely to strike something unintentionally, but can block fewer hits before it shatters completely.

speaker: blacksmith
dialog: Now go out there and see what you can do!
<while in the air, hold the [DOWN] arrow key to perform a hammer attack>
